intro: Dryandra cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dryandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to Western Australia and is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves and striking pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in open woodlands and heathlands, thriving in full sun. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a notable species in the region's biodiversity.
